item.title: Coronavirus: Young people warn of long Covid amid jab drive
item.description: The government says it has met its target to offer all 16 and 17-year-olds in England a vaccine.

item.title: Covid: Antibody tests offered to public for first time
item.description: The UK-wide scheme for adults who test positive for coronavirus will launch next week.

item.title: Covid: New Zealand pandemic strategy in doubt amid Delta spread
item.description: The highly infectious Delta variant "does change the game", the Covid response minister says.

item.title: Army supporting ambulance services in England
item.description: High demand and staffing shortages have meant the Army has been called in to help look after patients.

item.title: Covid: CO2 monitors pledged to aid school ventilation
item.description: Schools in England are to be given CO2 monitors to as part of plans to limit the spread of Covid.

item.title: Covid-antibody therapy approved in UK
item.description: Antibody therapy - given to former US President Donald Trump - can now be used in the UK.

item.title: Why a US military base became a centre for Chinese Covid conspiracies
item.description: Apparent Chinese propaganda efforts are spreading ahead of a US report on Covid-19 origins.

item.title: Covid cases: This summer compared with last
item.description: Case numbers are 30 times higher than at the same point last year - where might we be heading next?

item.title: Covid vaccine: Fertility and miscarriage claims fact-checked
item.description: Posts claiming Covid vaccines cause miscarriages are not supported by scientific evidence.

item.title: Is the coronavirus pandemic over at last?
item.description: As Scotland loosens most of its remaining restrictions, is the devastating pandemic finally at an end?

item.title: ‘Parkinson’s doesn't stop me playing tennis’
item.description: Andy Wright, who was diagnosed at 33, says his return to the sport helps alleviate symptoms.

item.title: Why bonding over the Euros appeared to increase Covid cases in men
item.description: Psychologists say men need to be part of a group in order to vent their feelings and emotions.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: Why you shouldn't get a second Covid jab too early
item.description: A government scientific advisor tells Newsbeat why four weeks is too soon between Covid jabs.

item.title: Beta coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: There are fears that this version of coronavirus, first identified in South Africa, is

item.title: Covid rules: How can the clinically vulnerable stay safe?
item.description: As social-distancing and other Covid rules end in England, how can people who were shielding stay safe?

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings?
item.description: Masks are no longer compulsory in England, but remain necessary in other parts of the UK.

item.title: How many cases in your area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Covid: What do under-30s need to know about the vaccine?
item.description: All over-16s in the UK can get the Covid vaccine, as well as some vulnerable younger teens.

item.title: What are the Delta, Gamma, Beta and Alpha Covid variants?
item.description: UK coronavirus cases are rising due to a variant first identified in India that spreads more easily.

item.title: Covid rules: What's changing in Wales, Scotland, England and Northern Ireland?
item.description: Lockdown rules are changing across the UK, but some restrictions remain in place.

item.title: Covid: How effective is the vaccine and do I need a booster?
item.description: All over-16s can get the Covid vaccine and boosters are expected to be rolled out from September.

item.title: How do we know Covid vaccines are safe?
item.description: Busting myths and explaining the facts around vaccines.

item.title: Coronavirus: What it does to the body
item.description: What is it like to have the coronavirus, how will it affect you and how is it treated?

item.title: Support bubbles: How do they work and who is in yours?
item.description: Some people across the UK have been able to form "support bubbles" or "extended households".

item.title: How to get a Covid test
item.description: Everyone in England and Scotland is being encouraged to take rapid coronavirus tests regularly.

item.title: All you need to know on the coronavirus
item.description: A new cough, fever and change in smell or taste are the key symptoms that mean you may have coronavirus.

item.title: Coronavirus: Intensive care and other key terms explained
item.description: Use our tool to check the meaning of key words and phrases associated with the Covid-19 outbreak.

item.title: Coronavirus: What is the risk to men over 50?
item.description: While most people will have mild symptoms and recover quickly, some are more prone to getting sick.

item.title: Coronavirus: Do face masks actually work?
item.description: With face masks in high demand, we look at whether they really can protect people from the virus.

item.title: 'You can change your life with sport'
item.description: Paralympic wheelchair basketball player Lucy Robinson wants to inspire others.

item.title: The West End star who worked as carer during lockdown
item.description: As theatres reopen, actors like Stephen Beckett have been swapping their lockdown jobs for their place on the stage once more.

item.title: Sport 'very important' in living with dementia
item.description: Gerard Doran, 62, said involvement with hillwalking and GAA have benefited him physically and mentally.

item.title: Lockdown screen time sees rise in short-sightedness among children
item.description: Optometrists are diagnosing higher numbers of children with short-sightedness since the start of the pandemic.

item.title: Covid: 'I'm pregnant, should I have the vaccine?'
item.description: Many pregnant women have declined the Covid jab, but what's best for the baby?
